CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 23, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "Election Scene - Attractive Constance Eskridge, minority inspector, smiles at some of 'Mom' Davis' humor while Lou Davenport, Republican political worker, and Carl Trapp, a Houstonite, exchange a few remarks. Gladys Hopkins, election board clerk, and John Gore, judge of elections, are shown handing ballots to voters. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Poll workers Constance Eskridge and "Mom" Davis seated behind table with voter cards, with others, including Lou or Lu Davenport, Carl Trapp, Election Board Clerk Gladys Hopkins, and Judge of Elections John Gore in polling place
